meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Food Adulteration (Metallic Contamination) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: air transhipment cargo (航空轉運貨物) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60); (29 of 2000 s. 5)
air transit cargo (航空過境貨物) means any article in transit that is both imported and consigned for export in an aircraft; (29 of 2000 s. 5)
article in transit (過境物品) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60); (29 of 2000 s. 5)
cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport (機場貨物轉運區) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60); (29 of 2000 s. 5)
metal (金屬) includes antimony, arsenic, boron and selenium; (L.N. 113 of 2018)
sell (售賣) includes offer, or expose for sale or have in possession for the purpose of sale.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Food prohibited for sale, etc. if its metal content exceeds certain level

subsection.content: A person must not import, consign, deliver, manufacture or sell for human consumption any specified food or compounded food which contains a specified metal in excess of the maximum level.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the maximum level of each specified metal in each specified food is specified in Part 2 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the maximum level of a specified metal in a specified food that has gone through a process of drying, dehydration or concentration is to be proportionally adjusted according to the change in the concentration of the metal in the food caused by the process.

subsection.leadIn: For paragraph (1), the maximum level of a specified metal in each specified food applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the edible portion of the food; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable, the portion of the food specified in, or the food in the form specified in, a note referred to in column 4 of Part 2 of the Schedule in relation to the food.

subsection.content: For paragraph (1), if all ingredients of a compounded food are specified food, the maximum level of a specified metal in the compounded food is the sum of the maximum level of the specified metal in each ingredient multiplied by the proportion, by weight, of the ingredient in the compounded food.

subsection.def: compounded food (複合食品) means food containing 2 or more ingredients;
specified food (指明食物) means any food specified in column 2 of Part 2 of the Schedule;
specified metal (指明金屬) means a metal specified in column 1 of Part 2 of the Schedule.

section.name: s3AA
section.heading: Food prohibited for sale, etc. if its metal level is dangerous or prejudicial to health

subsection.content: A person must not import, consign, deliver, manufacture or sell for human consumption any food containing any metal in an amount that is dangerous or prejudicial to health.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether an item of food contains a metal in an amount that is dangerous or prejudicial to health, regard must be had to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the probable effect of that item on the health of a person consuming it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the probable cumulative effect of food the composition of which is substantially the same as that item on the health of a person consuming the food in ordinary quantities.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Application to air transit or air transhipment cargo

subsection.leadIn: Regulations 3 and 3AA do not apply in relation to the import of any food referred to in those regulations that is air transit cargo or air transhipment cargo; but if at any time between its being brought into and taken out of Hong Kong such food is removed from the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport then, for the purposes of regulations 3 and 3AA— (L.N. 113 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the food is deemed to be imported at the time of such removal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who brought the food, or caused it to be brought, into Hong Kong as air transit cargo or air transhipment cargo is deemed to be the person who imports the food at the time of its removal,

subsection.continued: and, except to that extent, those regulations have effect as if this paragraph had not been enacted. (L.N. 113 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings against a person for an offence under regulation 5, being proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the import of any food referred to in regulation 3 or 3AA that is air transit cargo or air transhipment cargo; and (L.N. 113 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in which it is necessary for the prosecution to prove that, at any time between its being brought into and taken out of Hong Kong, the food was removed from the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport,

subsection.continued: it is a defence for the person to show that he took all reasonable steps and exercised reasonable diligence to avoid such removal occurring.

subsection.leadIn: Where in any proceedings the defence provided by paragraph (2) involves an allegation that the commission of the offence was due to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act or default of another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reliance on information given by another person,

subsection.continued: the defendant is not, without the leave of the court, entitled to rely on the defence unless, not less than 10 days before the hearing of the proceedings, he has served a notice in writing on the prosecutor giving all particulars of—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the person who committed the act or default or gave the information; and

subsection.continued: of which he is aware at the time he serves the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not entitled to rely on the defence provided by paragraph (2) by reason of his reliance on information supplied by another person, unless he shows that it was reasonable in all the circumstances for him to have relied on the information, having regard in particular to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the steps which he took, and those which might reasonably have been taken, for the purpose of verifying the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether he had any reason to disbelieve the information.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule
section.content: The Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the maximum levels specified in column 3 of Part 2 of the Schedule.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Offences and penalties
section.content: Any person who contravenes regulation 3 or 3AA commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Name in which proceedings may be brought
section.content: Without prejudice to the provisions of any other enactment relating to the prosecution of criminal offences, and without prejudice to the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecutions of criminal offences, prosecutions for an offence under any of the provisions of these regulations may be brought in the name of the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Grace period for importations, consignments, etc. from 5 September 2025 to 5 March 2027
section.leadIn: During the period between 5 September 2025 and 5 March 2027 (both dates inclusive), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person imports, consigns, delivers, manufactures or sells any specified food or compounded food for human consumption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had the person done so immediately before 5 September 2025, the person would not have contravened regulation 3 as in force immediately before that date,

section.continued: the person does not contravene regulation 3.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: aquatic animals (水生動物)—(a)includes—(i)fish;(ii)crustaceans;(iii)molluscs, including bivalve molluscs, cephalopods, gastropods; and(iv)any other aquatic invertebrate animals; but(b)does not include amphibians, marine mammals or reptiles;
infant formula (嬰兒配方產品) has the meaning given by regulation 2(1) of the Food and Drugs (Composition and Labelling) Regulations (Cap. 132 sub. leg. W);

milk (奶類) means the normal mammary secretion of milking animals that is—(a)obtained from one or more milkings without either addition or extraction; and(b)intended for consumption as liquid milk or for further processing;
secondary milk products (二次加工奶製品) means skimmed milk, partly skimmed milk, evaporated milk and milk powder.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Maximum Level of Metal in Food

Applies to edible portion after removal of bones (if any) and to fat from the meat.
Applies to edible portion after removal of the digestive tract (if any).
Crabs—applies to whole commodity (including the gonads, liver and other digestive organs) after removal of shell and gills.
Cephalopods—applies to edible portion after removal of shell and viscera.
Scallops—applies to edible portion after removal of shell and viscera.
Sea cucumbers—applies to whole commodity after removal of viscera.
Applies to edible portion after removal of shell (if any) and viscera.
Applies to fruit juices (not concentrated) or products reconstituted to the original juice concentration that are ready to drink. Also applies to nectars that are ready to drink.
Applies to fruits or vegetables (as the case may be).
Applies to products that are, or are reconstituted to be, ready to drink.
Applies to beverages that are, or are reconstituted to be, ready to drink.
Applies to products in dried form. (L.N. 140 of 2025)
nectars that are ready to drink; and
fruit juices intended to be consumed principally by persons under the age of 36 months. (L.N. 140 of 2025)
Applies to products that are not reconstituted or otherwise prepared for consumption. (L.N. 140 of 2025)

editorialNote.content: The "First Schedule" was repealed and substituted by "Schedule" (see s.10 of L.N. 113 of 2018).
